result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas A Cotner

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Email from the State requesting all TR cases track with CF case.

PLEASE NOTICE YOUR UPDATED ZOOM INFORMATION

Join Zoom Meeting

https://wicourts.zoom.us/j/83903782154

Meeting ID: 839 0378 2154

Phone:      312-626-6799

3:15 PM Defendant Thomas A Cotner appeared by video.   Laurie Osberg appeared via video for PD office.   DA Annette Barna appeared in person.  Matter set for bail/bond hearing.   State contacted the Trooper.  Attorney Osberg updated Court on DE's background.  Attorney Osberg argued for a signature bond.   State argued for a $500  cash bond, no contact with Trooper Mulhulland, and absolute sobriety.   Court ordered $2500 signature bond with conditions of Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.    And no contact with WSP Trooper Mulhulland unless he initiates the contact.   DE intends to make application for a court appointed counsel as he does not qualify for PD.  Adj. 3:21 PM

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.    And no contact with WSP Trooper Mulhulland unless he initiates the contact.
PC statement emailed to Jail, PD office, and DA office 7/5/22-lg
